Forensic Neurology Services

Get credible medical testimony from board-certified neurology expert witnesses. Specializing in causation analysis, IME, & TBI claims. Call Neuro Experts today!

Neurologic exams + causation

Objective evaluations that link clinical findings to legal questions.

IME + record review

Thorough analysis of MRI, CT, EEG, and EMG evidence.

Multidisciplinary support

Integrated neuroradiology and neuropsychology collaboration.

Credible Medical Testimony for Complex Neurological Claims

When the stakes are high and neurological claims are challenged, you need expertise that stands up to scrutiny and communicates with clarity. At Neuro Experts, PC, we deliver comprehensive forensic neurological assessments for medico-legal consultancy, including expert opinions, medical evaluations, and neurology expert witness services.

Our team of highly experienced neuroradiology and neuroscience experts delivers defensible expert testimony that judges and juries can understand. We evaluate neurologic conditions, assess neuropsychiatric symptoms, and interpret their legal significance. This includes forensic neuropsychology, neuropsychological assessment, psychological testing, and cognitive evaluation for legal matters, providing expert insights into how brain function influences behavior, decision-making, and legal capacities.

Independent, board-certified neurologists provide objective causation analysis and courtroom-ready reporting.

When to Engage a Forensic Neurology Expert

You need forensic neurological services when a case requires objective, medically grounded answers about injury, causation, or functional impact. Without expert interpretation, neurologic findings can be misread or undervalued, weakening the clarity and strength of your legal position. We help attorneys and courts understand complex clinical findings and connect them directly to the legal issues that matter.

Did You Know?

  • In the past decade, courts have admitted neurologic evidence such as MRI, PET, and EEG findings in more than 2,800 criminal cases. Source
  • Clinical forensic neurology has a well-established legal history, with neurologic evidence being used in criminal proceedings for more than 150 years. Source

Our forensic neurology services apply to a wide range of cases that require neurological or psychological evaluation, including family law matters, capacity assessments, wills and trusts, disability determinations, injury-related claims, and issues involving criminal liability.

Who Do We Serve?

We provide forensic neurology services to attorneys (plaintiff and defense), insurance carriers, courts, employers, and individuals seeking objective, medically grounded evaluations. Our assessments offer critical medical insight across:

Legal & Administrative Claims

We establish medical causation, neurologic prognosis, and life expectancy in matters such as personal injury, workers' compensation, toxic torts, and catastrophic incidents (e.g., traumatic neurologic events, spinal cord injury, acquired neurological disease).

Medical Liability

We conduct standard-of-care reviews and causation analyses for medical malpractice, including delayed diagnosis of neurologic disease, surgical complications, birth injuries, and other neuro-medical adversities.

Criminal Legal Cases

We provide neurologic evidence related to brain pathology (tumors, epilepsy, neurodegenerative disease) in matters of competency to stand trial, insanity defenses, and sentencing mitigation.

Fitness & Disability

We determine fitness for duty in safety-sensitive roles and validate clinical and neurodiagnostic diagnoses in disability insurance or employment disputes.

Core Services

Independent Medical Examinations (IME)

We perform detailed neurological exams to assess reflexes, gait, and motor function and identify neurological pathology.

  • Distinguish genuine conditions from subjective symptom reports.
  • Resolve civil and insurance disputes with objective findings.

Record Review & Diagnostic Analysis

We re-evaluate MRI, CT, EEG, and EMG studies to verify accuracy and identify pre-existing conditions that mimic new injury.

  • Validate original diagnoses with evidence-based analysis.
  • Ground causation opinions in objective findings.

Consultation & Standard of Care Review

We review malpractice and negligence cases to determine whether proper neurological care was provided.

  • Identify failure-to-diagnose issues, including missed strokes or tumors.
  • Assess case strengths and weaknesses with clinical clarity.

Expert Testimony & Causation Analysis

We analyze timing, symptoms, and diagnostics to determine the most likely cause of a neurological condition.

  • Evaluate all medically plausible explanations.
  • Deliver clear, defensible opinions in court.

Workers' Compensation & Toxic Tort Evaluations

We assess toxic exposures, repetitive stress, and spinal cord injuries to determine MMI and disability ratings.

  • Clarify workplace impact on neurological health.
  • Support long-term care planning and reporting.

Additional Services

We provide specialized evaluations that support litigation strategy and long-term care decisions.

  • Fitness for duty assessments for safety-sensitive roles.
  • Testamentary capacity and guardianship evaluations.
  • Life expectancy reports for catastrophic injury cases.

Integrated Neurology + Imaging + Cognition

At Neuro Experts, PC, we offer a full suite of services designed to support a wide range of medico-legal needs. Each specialty can be used on its own or combined for a more complete evaluation.

Neurologic evaluation

We establish medical causation and document clinical findings through expert neurologic assessment.

Advanced imaging review

Neuroradiologists add depth with MRI and CT analysis that identifies subtle neurologic findings.

Functional impact

Forensic neuropsychologists quantify how neurologic changes affect cognition, behavior, and capacity.

Defensible reporting

We translate clinical evidence into clear, court-ready opinions that meet legal requirements.

Why Choose Us?

  • Board-certified neurologists with fellowship training in specialized subspecialties.
  • Clear communication that translates complex data into understandable language without losing scientific rigor.
  • Reliable availability for evaluations, depositions, and trial testimony with strict adherence to deadlines.
  • Objective, ethical reporting grounded in evidence, not advocacy.

With Neuro Experts, PC, you receive expert testimony you can trust and neurological evaluations backed by uncompromising clinical and forensic standards.

FAQ

What does a forensic neurology evaluation involve?

Our evaluations go far beyond a standard clinical visit. We conduct a comprehensive investigation to establish facts. This includes:

  • Comprehensive History and Record Review: We gather detailed history and analyze medical records, police reports, employment files, military records, and witness statements.
  • Neurological Examination: We perform focused physical and cognitive assessments to evaluate neurological function.
  • Collateral Interviews: We speak with family members or witnesses to confirm behavioral patterns and event timelines.
  • Additional Testing When Needed: We recommend further studies such as MRI, CT, EEG, psychiatric evaluations, or neuropsychological testing.
  • Intent and Behavior Analysis: We determine whether neurological factors may have influenced actions or decision-making.
  • Medico-Legal Interpretation: We provide clear, defensible opinions that directly address the legal questions in the case.
How do you determine the link between a diagnosis and legal liability?

We utilize a rigorous three-step reasoning process:

  • Diagnostic: Confirming the presence or absence of a neurologic diagnosis (e.g., TBI, epilepsy, dementia).
  • Behavioral: Analyzing how that specific diagnosis affected the individual's behavior, cognition, and mental capacity.
  • Forensic: Determining if these impairments meet the specific legal criteria for the case (e.g., insanity, incompetence, or damages).
How does your role as a forensic expert differ from that of a treating physician?

While a treating physician focuses on patient welfare, our primary duty in a forensic context is to the truth. We provide objective, educational opinions to the judge and jury. We report findings based on evidence, regardless of whether the outcome favors the evaluee, ensuring the highest level of ethical integrity and credibility in court.

Can your neurologists testify effectively during trial proceedings?

Yes. Providing courtroom testimony as a neurologist expert witness is a crucial component of our services. We are experienced in:

  • Communicating complex neurologic concepts clearly to juries and judges.
  • Defending data-backed opinions vigorously during cross-examination.
  • Navigating courtroom dynamics.
Who can schedule a forensic evaluation?

While anyone seeking a neurological assessment may request a forensic evaluation, these evaluations are most often arranged by attorneys, insurance representatives, human resources professionals, or other parties involved in legal, occupational, or administrative proceedings.
